sen.j: 藤原 保成（ふじわら の やすなり、生没年未詳）は平安時代末期の廷臣。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Yasunari (year of birth and death unknown) was a retainer of Imperial Court at the end of Heian Period.

sen.e: He was a child of Sangi (Councilor) FUJIWARA no Ieyasu.

sen.j: 兄弟に藤原家成（中納言、四条家祖）、藤原家長らがある。
sen.e: His brothers included FUJIWARA no Ienari (Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), founder of the Shijo family) and FUJIWARA no Ienaga.

sen.j: 従四位下、蔵人、美濃国守。
sen.e: He was Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Kurodo (Chamberlain) and Mino no kuni no kami (the governor of Mino Province).
He attained the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and the posts of Kurodo (Chamberlain) and Kami (Governor) of Mino Province.

sen.j: 崇徳天皇の乳母子であった関係からその傍に仕え、新院判官代と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Due to the fact that he was menotogo (the son of a menoto, a woman providing breast-feed to a highborn baby) of Emperor Sutoku, he served the Emperor and was called Shin-in Hogandai (administrative official of the newly Retired-Emperor's Office.)
Since he was the son of Emperor Sutoku's wet nurse, he served the Emperor and was called Shin-in Hogandai (an official of the newly-Retired Emperor's Office.)

sen.j: 大治 (日本)2年（1127年）に蔵人、久安2年（1146年）には正五位下に叙され、その後従四位下（あるいは正四位下）まで進む。
sen.e: He was appointed Kurodo in 1127, raised to Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 1146 and later promoted up to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) (or Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade)).

sen.j: しかし、保元元年（1156年）の保元の乱に際し、崇徳上皇方に参加。
sen.e: However, he participated in the side of the retired Emperor Sutoku in the Hogen Disturbance in 1156.

sen.j: 敗戦後、配所に赴く上皇が仁和寺を出立する際に保成の車を使用したことが、『保元物語』に見える。
sen.e: "Hogen Monogatari" (The Tale of the Hogen War) described that when the retired Emperor left Ninna-ji Temple to go to Haisho (the place where a criminal is sent) after the lost battle, he used Yasunari's Kuruma.
sen.cmt: 「車」は牛車（ぎっ‐しゃ）のことではないかと思いますが、不明ですので、「Kuruma」といたしました。
sen.e: "Hogen Monogatari" (The Tale of the Hogen War) describes how when the retired Emperor left Ninna-ji Temple to go into exile after losing the battle, he used Yasunari's cart.
"Hogen Monogatari" (The Tale of the Hogen War) describes that, when the Retired Emperor left Ninna-ji Temple to go into exile after losing the battle, he used Yasunari's cart.
sen.cmt: カンマ追加、how→that、the retired Emperor→the Retired Emperorとしました。

sen.j: ただし保成自身については、戦後の処罰を含め、その後の動静は不明である。
sen.e: However, as for Yasunari himself, his movements after the Disturbance including punishment upon him was unknown.
However, Yasunari's movements after the Disturbance, including any punishment he received, are unknown.
